sentences.en: A stately liner can sail serenely through turmoil that would capsize even the sturdiest small vessel.
sentences.cn: 一艘雄伟邮轮可以安然驶过动荡,而小船,即便是最结实的,也不堪一击.

sentences.en: A sudden strong wind capsize their boat.
sentences.cn: 突然一阵强风弄翻了他们的船.

sentences.en: Be careful not to capsize the boat.
Don't rock the boat or it will capsize!
sentences.cn: 不要摇晃小船,否则它会翻的.

sentences.en: I feel. Me like fury of the sea in a boat to capsize possible moment.
sentences.cn: 我感觉. 我就像暴怒大海中地一艘时刻可能倾覆地小船.

sentences.en: The boat will capsize if you don't sit down.
sentences.cn: 你要是不坐下,船就要翻了.

sentences.en: The crew, believing that their vessel was about to capsize, abandoned ship in the Bering sea.
sentences.cn: 船员们感到这艘船即将倾覆, 消逝在白令海.

sentences.en: The sea got very rough and the boat capsized.
sentences.cn: 海的风浪变得很大，船翻了。

trans.tran_en: if a boat capsizes, or if you capsize it, it turns over in the water
